taxon_name.authority: Schimper in P. Bruch and W. P. Schimper

place_of_publication.publication_title: in P. Bruch and W. P. Schimper, Bryol. Europ.

taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [Greek heteros , differing, and kladion , branchlet, alluding to growth form]

bio:treatment.description: Plants in wiry wefts, dark green to olive green, occasionally yellowish. Stems irregularly branched to pinnate; paraphyllia few or absent. Leaves appressed or squarrose, imbricate, dimorphic, stem leaves ovate-acuminate, branch leaves ovate; margins plane, serrate, serrulate, or papillose-serrate; apex acute to acuminate; costa single, short, usually 2-fid or double to mid leaf, broad basally; alar cells not differentiated; laminal cells quadrate to rhomboidal, strongly papillose or smooth, walls thickened; basal and juxtacostal cells elongate. Capsule horizontal, short-cylindric, curved.
bio:treatment.discussion: Heterocladium frequently has elongate to flagellate branches. The seta is 0.1–0.2 cm and smooth; the capsule is brown; the operculum is conic-apiculate to short-rostrate; the peristome is perfect, with 2 or 3 elongate, nodose cilia; and the spores are 10–18 µm and essentially smooth.

key_statement.description: Laminal cells smooth; leaves squarrose-spreading when dry
Laminal cells smooth or papillose; leaves spreading to erect-appressed when dry.

Laminal cell papillae 1 at distal ends; basal cells smooth; stem epidermal cells smooth; leaf margins serrate to serrulate
